user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_unames_size:
```c
_MHD_static_inline size_t
get_rq_unames_size (const struct MHD_RqDAuth *params,
                    enum MHD_DigestAuthUsernameType uname_type)
{
  size_t s;

  mhd_assert (get_rq_uname_type (params) == uname_type);
  s = 0;
  if ((MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD == uname_type) ||
      (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == uname_type) )
  {
    s += params->username.value.len + 1; /* Add one byte for zero-termination */
    if (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == uname_type)
      s += (params->username.value.len + 1) / 2;
  }
  else if (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_EXTENDED == uname_type)
    s += params->username_ext.value.len
         - MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_MIN_LEN + 1; /* Add one byte for zero-termination */
  return s;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if ((MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD == uname_type) ||
    (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == uname_type) )
{
  s += params->username.value.len + 1; /* Add one byte for zero-termination */
  if (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == uname_type)
    s += (params->username.value.len + 1) / 2;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. Both branches of the outer if are potentially reachable (when uname_type == MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD or == MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH). The inner if (checking USERHASH) is reachable whenever uname_type == USERHASH, so there is no unreachable code in the fragment.
